group_1.textRight: I hate to admit it...@but I guess it's to be expected...

group_1.textLeft: Please tell me more about it.

group_1.textCenter: I wanted to be someone with a strong heart@who could protect and save others,
and that's why I made a contract as a Magical Girl.
Since then, Asuka and I teamed up,
and we've rescued plenty of people, but...
my real desire was a need for recognition,@for someone to thank me.
But Magical Girls are shadowy figures@that save people unseen.
No one thanked me, so I was unsatisfied,
and I was nearly swallowed up by dark emotions...
but when I saw that picture of a Witch, it reminded@me of my ugly nature that I realized back then...

group_1.textLeft: Are you going to continue to live@with that need for approval?

group_1.textRight: I've worried about that a lot.
But if I denied that desire,
I feel like I'd be denying my admiration for my dad.
From the start, my need for approval came@from wanting to be like him.
That's what he called it, that rescue team@he was always working so hard at.
That's why I want to become someone@that others can admire.
Not just as a Magical Girl,@but in my personal life as well.
...I haven't really thought it through all the way, but,
even outside of life-threatening situations,@people can worry themselves to the brink of death.
If I can save the hearts of people like that,@I think that'd be the perfect way to help people.
Maybe someday, when I'm thanked, I'll be able to@feel happy without having a complex about it.
...Well, that's just a thought for now,@but I won't know until I try.
I might never be appreciated as a Magical Girl, but...
someday, I'll pull off the best@rescue possible in my own way.

group_1.textLeft: It's that desire for admiration@that makes you burn up.
